headline: Las Vegas Sands (LVS) Q4 2025 Earnings Transcript
summary: Robert Goldstein: Thank you, Dan, and good afternoon.  Marina Bay Sands delivered EBITDA of $806 million, simply the greatest quarter in the history of casino hotels.  Macao delivered $608 million of EBITDA for the quarter, and we are disappointed with that EBITDA number.

content.title: Las Vegas Sands (LVS) Q4 2025 Earnings Transcript
content.summary: Robert Goldstein: Thank you, Dan, and good afternoon.  Marina Bay Sands delivered EBITDA of $806 million, simply the greatest quarter in the history of casino hotels.  Macao delivered $608 million of EBITDA for the quarter, and we are disappointed with that EBITDA number.

thumbnail.caption: Logo of jester cap with thought bubble.

headline: Las Vegas Sands Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS) executives highlighted record performance at Marina Bay Sands and ongoing efforts to improve profitability in Macau during the company’s fourth quarter 2025 earnings call, while also outlining continued capital returns to shareholders and a leadership transition for Chairm

headline: Las Vegas Sands Stock Tumbles 10%. It Has a Macau Problem.
summary: Las Vegas Sands earnings weren’t all that bad but the company has a problem in Macau—the world’s largest gambling hub.  Las Vegas Sands  stock was down 10.3% to $54.97 in premarket trading Thursday.  Fourth quarter earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (Ebitda) from Macau clocked in at $608 million.

content.title: Las Vegas Sands Stock Tumbles 10%. It Has a Macau Problem.
content.summary: Las Vegas Sands earnings weren’t all that bad but the company has a problem in Macau—the world’s largest gambling hub.  Las Vegas Sands  stock was down 10.3% to $54.97 in premarket trading Thursday.  Fourth quarter earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (Ebitda) from Macau clocked in at $608 million.

headline: Nevada reports December statewide gaming win down 1.55% to $1.44B
summary: Nevada Gaming Control Board reports December Las Vegas Strip gaming win down 6.07% versus last year to $827.73M. Publicly traded companies in the space gambling include Boyd Gaming (BYD), Caesars (CZR), Churchill Downs (CHDN), DraftKings (DKNG), Flutter Entertainment (FLUT), Gan Limited (GAN), Genius Sports (GENI), Las Vegas Sands (LVS), MGM Resorts (MGM), Penn Entertainment (PENN), Rush Street Interactive (RSI), Sportradar (SRAD) and Wynn Resorts (WYNN).Claim 50% Off TipRanks PremiumUnlock hedg

headline: Stocks to Watch Thursday: Honeywell, Southwest, Alphabet
summary: ↗️ Honeywell (HON): The industrial conglomerate, which is in the process of restructuring and spinning off several businesses, reported mixed quarterly results. The stock gained about 3.5%. ↘️ Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL): Google used a court order to remove dozens of internet domains belonging to Ipidea.

headline: Las Vegas Sands Stock Tumbles 13%. It Has a Macau Problem.
summary: Las Vegas Sands earnings weren’t all that bad but the company has a problem in Macau—the world’s largest gambling hub.  Las Vegas Sands  stock was down 13% to $53.36, the worst performing stock in the  early Thursday.  Its on track for its biggest daily drop since March 16, 2020 when it fell 17.6%, according to Dow Jones Market Data.
